Package com.example.recipeoop_1.dto

Class RecipeResponse

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.dto.RecipeResponse
public class RecipeResponse extends Object
Data Transfer Object (DTO) for representing a paginated list of recipes.

This class is typically used as a standardized response format for API endpoints that return recipes with pagination details such as page number, page size, total elements, and total pages.

Since:
2025-05-14
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • RecipeResponse

      public RecipeResponse()
      Default constructor for RecipeResponse. Required for frameworks like Jackson for JSON deserialization, although this class is primarily used for serialization (API responses).

    • RecipeResponse

      public RecipeResponse(List<Recipe> content, int pageNo, int pageSize, long totalElements, int totalPages, boolean last)
      Constructs a RecipeResponse with all pagination details and content.
      Parameters:
      content - The list of Recipe objects for the current page.
      pageNo - The current page number.
      pageSize - The size of the page.
      totalElements - The total number of recipes available.
      totalPages - The total number of pages.
      last - A boolean indicating if this is the last page.

  • Method Details

    • fromPageable

      public static RecipeResponse fromPageable(org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Recipe> recipePage)
      Static factory method to create a RecipeResponse from a Spring Data Page object.

      This provides a convenient way to convert the result of a paginated repository query into the standardized RecipeResponse format.

      Parameters:
      recipePage - The Page object containing Recipe instances and pagination information. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      A new RecipeResponse populated with data from the provided recipePage.
